metadata.Title: CVE-2017-9233 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Compliant (bionic) - medium.
metadata.Description:
XML External Entity vulnerability in libexpat 2.2.0 and earlier (Expat XML Parser Library) allows attackers to put the parser in an infinite loop using a malformed external entity definition from an external DTD.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-9233` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

expat - 2.2.1-2
libexpat1 - 2.2.1-2
No subscription required

firefox - 67.0.4+build1-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
firefox-globalmenu - 67.0.4+build1-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
firefox-mozsymbols - 67.0.4+build1-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
firefox-testsuite - 67.0.4+build1-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
No subscription required

thunderbird - 60.7.1+build1-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
thunderbird-gnome-support - 60.7.1+build1-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
thunderbird-mozsymbols - 60.7.1+build1-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
xul-ext-calendar-timezones - 60.7.1+build1-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
xul-ext-gdata-provider - 60.7.1+build1-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
xul-ext-lightning - 60.7.1+build1-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
No subscription required

notes.Note: mdeslaur> we will not be fixing this in thunderbird, marking as ignored rodrigo-zaiden> libxmltok does not include entityValueInitProcessor function. so, it's not affected. ccdm94> cmake 3.20.5 and forward uses expat 2.2.10+.

criterions.comment: coin3: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
expat package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.2.1-2').
firefox package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '67.0.4+build1-0ubuntu0.18.04.1').
